meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling plasma.
meanings.sent1: The plasmatic glow of the neon sign caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the plasmatic properties of the sun's corona.
meanings.sent3: The plasmatic colors of the painting seemed to dance in the light.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like a plasmatic force, vibrant and ever-changing.
meanings.sent5: The plasmatic waves in the experiment were mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.sent1: The plasmatic membrane of the cell allowed nutrients to pass through.
meanings.sent2: The plasmatic state of matter is fascinating to learn about in science class.
meanings.sent3: The plasmatic screen on the new TV made the colors pop.
meanings.sent4: The plasmatic core of the star was incredibly hot and dense.
meanings.sent5: The plasmatic fluid in the experiment reacted unexpectedly to the temperature change.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the presence of plasma.
meanings.sent1: The plasmatic atmosphere of the room made it feel alive.
meanings.sent2: The plasmatic cloud in the sky was a rare sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The plasmatic energy in the room seemed to spark creativity in everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her plasmatic aura was so strong that it seemed to light up the room.
meanings.sent5: The plasmatic glow around the object indicated a high energy level.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the fluid portion of blood or lymph.
meanings.sent1: The plasmatic component of the blood carries nutrients to the cells.
meanings.sent2: The plasmatic fluid in the body helps maintain proper hydration.
meanings.sent3: The plasmatic flow in the veins is essential for circulation.
meanings.sent4: The plasmatic nature of lymph aids in immune system function.
meanings.sent5: The plasmatic quality of blood is crucial for overall health.
